messages: b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (20:28): Then go make some, you bum.
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (20:30): and a bagel with cream cheese, please.
9e34a17ba187fc6d38d7129751463b81 (20:53): i am getting errror" VirtualHost *:80 -- mixing * ports and non-* ports with a NameVirtualHost address is not supported"
9e34a17ba187fc6d38d7129751463b81 (20:53): what shall i do to correct this?

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (20:54): The value of a NameVirtualHost directive has to match the content of <VirtualHost> exactly. For example, NameVirtualHost *:80 must be used with <VirtualHost *:80>
9e34a17ba187fc6d38d7129751463b81 (20:56): fajita: i dont have any NameVirtualHost directive
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (20:56): gnufied: Sorry, I don't know.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (20:57): That's unlikely, gnufied. Also, don't use the host name in <VirtualHost namehere> Do as fajita said.
9e34a17ba187fc6d38d7129751463b81 (21:00): noodl: <VirtualHost *:80>
9e34a17ba187fc6d38d7129751463b81 (21:00): ServerName *.foobar.com </VirtualHost>
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:02): ServerName doesn't take wildcards. You need ServerAlias for that. See:
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:02): vhost examples?
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (21:02): vhost examples is http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/vhosts/examples.html or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/vhosts/examples.html
dc9c90c1cc3955898a5d92bf70b1d5cb (21:18): hi, can you tell me does L3 cache of proccesor give some better performance for LAMP server? (linux,apache,mysql,php), please help me
dc9c90c1cc3955898a5d92bf70b1d5cb (21:22): hello?
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (21:22): is there anybody in there
c0b4e83f1d8ef871afa012d708a6728f (21:22): Just yell if you can hear me
dc9c90c1cc3955898a5d92bf70b1d5cb (21:23): hi, can you tell me does L3 cache of proccesor give some better performance for LAMP server? (linux,apache,mysql,php), please help me
18eb6e0ab77e11fdec364a1beadd07ac (21:23): repeat your question 3 more times. You didnt ask it enough yet. We don't answer questions that are not asked at least 5 times in a row
dc9c90c1cc3955898a5d92bf70b1d5cb (21:25): gryzor: do you tell to me?
c0b4e83f1d8ef871afa012d708a6728f (21:25): Now you have to start over again.
c0b4e83f1d8ef871afa012d708a6728f (21:26): And, to be honest, why wouldn't an L3 cache give better performance?
c0b4e83f1d8ef871afa012d708a6728f (21:26): Compared to an L2, of course.
616abfefac6918b99f26c52732e3535b (21:26): it's farther away from the processor, that's why. jeesh.
616abfefac6918b99f26c52732e3535b (21:27): it's a whole level farther!
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:30): hi. in my apache access log, i see that some "GET /%BB HTTP/1.1" now and then. is the '%BB' part used for anything special?
8377bb17efed04dfb6c4352f06d60ffe (21:36): hi all
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (21:36): He's not here today

5a5a867c687778f6a8648799e0da2f30 (21:39): for anyone interested, I have written a (GPL) httpd log parser wrapper. It sorts and merges httpd log files, feeds them to a parser/analyzer (currently visitors and analog are supported) and optionally emails the output to a user specified email address. The URL is http://www.stavridis.org/eleftherios/01.02/
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:40): chasba: That's a url encoded double right arrow. How odd! What's your server's responce code to that?
5097a5e23703d1ff0254e74ee7258c30 (21:41): fajita: mod_disk_cache
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (21:41): barefoot: mod_disk_cache is http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_disk_cache.html
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:42): This looks great eleftherios. Does it...
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:43): noodl: 404, so i ain't that afraid. it is just kinda strange since several different visitors have requested it.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:45): chasba: It's not a request I've seen. Maybe you have a html link somewhere in your site like <a href="¬´" ?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:47): Or more likely, you or someone else has a link to your site and at the end of the link they hit meta-> ? That could have generated that character.
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:48): noodl: not that i know of, no. the user only asked "GET /%BB HTTP/1.1" (404) and "GET /favicon.ico HTTP/1.1" (200). nothing else, heh.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:48): Well sure, they wanted your frontpage but were using a bad link. Do you have referrers in your logs?
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:49): nope, nothing.
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (21:49): nope, nothing is running on port 80
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:49): You don't log referrals, or there isn't one for this??
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:49): fajita: no, nope, nothing is <reply>
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (21:49): noodl: Okay.
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:50): there isn't one for this. if i remember correctly, the same, but older, requests also came with no referrals.
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:51): i'll send you a notice with the url if that is okay with you?
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:52): currently searching thru the access log after the older enteries btw.
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:53): i've found 5-6 other now and none of them have referrals.
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:53): ehrm, others.
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:55): all of which have resulted in a 404, so i guess i got my question answered with 'url encoded double right arrow'. thanks, noodl. :)
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:55): You use the same character on your home page, but not in a link.
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:56): &raquo; etc.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:57): You like mogwai?
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:57): a true post-rock fanatic you might say.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:58): heard them live a couple of years ago supporting the cure. they were awesome, really filled the park with dreamy noises.
35d0cc359682e1dab5a25d7c7cf0f9a0 (21:59): noodl: the problem with locating all the log message is that a lot of modules hide ap_ calls in macros
685c8381adf4d5d8e0958c2904b9ba02 (21:59): noodl: i couldn't agree more. i've seen them several times myself, they keep me coming back for more. their new album is really amazing. :)
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (21:59): Hi RoUS. Have you been chatting with DrB? I noticed that mod_cgi uses its own logging function.

7b65a4becf0501b61bb6b508085ebb4f (22:00): hi guys. I'm running webdav with apache22 and I'd like the virtualhost which has it enabled to write its files under a user other than the User defined in the global conf
35d0cc359682e1dab5a25d7c7cf0f9a0 (22:00): noodl: no, i just noticed that xchat said someone mentioned my nick, and scrolled back to find it.
7b65a4becf0501b61bb6b508085ebb4f (22:00): however it seems I cant use the User directive anymore inside a <VirtualHost> with apache22. is there another way to accomplish this?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (22:00): RoUS: Anyway, I don't mind looking at each module to get an idea of how it logs errors. It's the collating and explaining part that's going to take a while.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (22:01): RoUS: While you're here, what's the issue with yngvi not being able to follow Include? Is that Apache::Config::Admin or ynvgi?

7b65a4becf0501b61bb6b508085ebb4f (22:02): http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mpm_common.html#user is saying 'Special note: Use of this directive in <VirtualHost> is no longer supported.', but gives no alternatives
35d0cc359682e1dab5a25d7c7cf0f9a0 (22:02): Apache::Config::Admin
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (22:02): Ok. I'm just porting that to ruby so maybe I'll figure it out.
35d0cc359682e1dab5a25d7c7cf0f9a0 (22:02): the problem is that include is context-sensitive, which means depth-major recursion
35d0cc359682e1dab5a25d7c7cf0f9a0 (22:03): i haven't been able to figure out a way around it using the module, so i've been toying with other eays
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (22:03): choongii: Apache can't setuid without the help of mpms like peruser. It's often easier to run two installations in a proxy setup though.

1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (22:05): RoUS: I don't follow how it's context sensitive.. Isn't it just a lexical "take that and glue it here" thing? I guess there's the tricky part of loop avoidance. The same file can be Included several times, but shouldn't include its includer.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (22:07): RoUS: Is that what you meant by depth-major recursion? I'm not familiar with the term.
7b65a4becf0501b61bb6b508085ebb4f (22:07): noodl, hmm alright, thanks
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (22:08): peruser is http://www.telana.com/peruser.php or a third-party product - check the documentation from its authors
